reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Miscellaneous/Other Contractual Services - Other Contractual Services NOC (A, B, C) (ITA) (INS) (FAS). ATA Warehouse Ops

description.narrative: Combat transnational terrorism, especially from al-Qa'ida, its affiliates, and adherents using a strategic counterterrorism approach that focuses on 1) countering violent extremism; 2) building the capacity of civilian law enforcement and criminal justice institutions to address threats within their own borders; and 3) building stronger relationships with our partners around the world – in order to engage in a broader, more comprehensive counterterrorism effort that treats civilian institutions, to include the justice sector and law enforcement, as a critical part of building effective partner capacity to counter terrorism.

This award strives to combat transnational terrorism, counter violent extremism, build the capacity of civilian law enforcement and criminal justice institutuions, and build stronger relationships with our partners around the world. This includes Information has been redacted in accordance with the two principled exceptions defined in the Foreign Aid Transparency and Accountability Act (FATAA) of 2016: the health and security of implementing partners, and the national interest of the United States.. TRAIN, EVAL & OTH RELATED ACT Information Redacted[Covers miscellaneous contractual services not otherwise classified under Miscellaneous/Other Contractual Services.]. TRAIN, EVAL & OTH RELATED ACT Information Redacted[Covers the cost of transporting U.S. Government property. Does not include transportation of U.S. Government vehicles (see 2221) or unaccompanied pouches (see 2222) or information technology equipment or supplies (see 2204). Includes parcel post when separately identified.].

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Uganda is a key strategic partner for the United States, particularly with regard to regional stabilization. The United States employs a wide-ranging approach to foreign assistance in Uganda based on diverse economic, political, and security interests. Given its role as a regional stabilizer, the United States has consistently worked with the Government of Uganda (GOU) to resolve regional security threats and conflicts. U.S. support is critical for enabling democratic institutions to function effectively and for fostering more sustainable and equitable national development - elements that are essential to both short and long-term stability in the East Africa region. To achieve these objectives, U.S. assistance includes: promoting good governance, human rights, and multi-party democracy; addressing key health threats, including HIV/AIDS and malaria, through improved service delivery under the Global Health Initiative (GHI); supporting Uganda's National Development Plan in improving agricultural productivity, food security and nutrition through the Feed the Future (FTF) initiative; professionalizing the police and military; and addressing critical environmental issues, including global climate change and biodiversity.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
